content: @Josh Mandel has just changed the current build so that a build failure no longer wipes the existing version of the IG from the last successful build.
We'll see what other fun/exciting bugs result from this change ;-) Please @-mention me here if you spot anything weird.

Hi @Josh Mandel great improvement on the no-wipe-on-failure update, thank you! Unfortunately our IG had _already_ failed at that point :) Something about gzip and a null pointer. Are you able to look here and give an opinion if this is a publisher issue or something we've done wrong please? http://build.fhir.org/ig/IHTSDO/snomed-ig/failure/build.log @Rob Hausam says his local build is succeeding.
This looks like just a failing build, rather than a problem with the CI infrastructure. I don't have any insight into this.
On a Mac. Haven't tried it on Linux.
We have some errors to clean up, but the build itself is successful.
it runs ok if the package it is trying to load is in the cache. I'll investigate
It fails for me when I run the docker container locally
Just realized we're having this discussion on announce - please move to committers
